page.title: 07THE LANES
page.content: The Lanes are Brightons top attraction after the seafront.They are a compact series of streets containing over one hundred antique shops.The name is believed to have originated from the Medieval word "Leines" meaning a place where fishermen dry their nets. In 1833 the area was described as a "A despised plebeian housing quarter with a humble emporium of industry". This has now become one of the most famous and fashionable areas of Brighton.Many visitors are able to make expensive purchases of old porcelain, ivory, bric-a-brac and antiques, as well as sit in one of the many pleasant cafes and restaurants.
